alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Kearney; Merrick; Nance; Phelps; Polk (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 11:11PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG WINDS POSSIBLE FROM HEAT BURST... At 1055 PM CDT, strong winds and a rapid but brief warming spike in temperatures occurred in Lexington in Dawson County. This rare weather phenomenon called a heat burst will remain possible along a dieing line of thunderstorms generally from the Lexington/Elwood area...to Kearney...to Grand Island...to Central City and Genoa through 1 AM. Wind speeds of 50 to around 60 mph will be possible with these dieing thunderstorms. Heat bursts are caused by decaying thunderstorms and only develop in an extremely unique environment. The rare setup for a heat burst is dry air directly beneath a weakening elevated thunderstorm. When a thunderstorm is weakening, air within the thunderstorms begins to sink. If this sinking air is very dry and high enough, it will begin to accelerate toward the ground since it is more dense. Any remaining precipitation will fall through this dry air and quickly evaporate. As the air continues downward, it warms rapidly due to compression.

area.areaDesc: Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Hall; Hamilton; Howard; Kearney; Merrick; Nance; Phelps; Polk
